title: Nvidia Reports Earnings Today. Here's What to Expect.
text: Nvidia is set to report third-quarter earnings results after the market closes on Wednesday.

title: Markets Bouncy, Buoyant on Key Econ, Earnings
text: The S&P 500 closed within a hair of fresh all-time closing highs, while the Nasdaq won the day, back up near 16K.

title: Nvidia Analyst Raises Price Target By 78%: 'Chipmaker Has Largest TAM Expansion Opportunity In All Of Tech'
text: Nvidia, Inc. (NASDAQ:NVDA) shares received a big upward price target revision from Credit Suisse shortly ahead of the graphic chipmaker's quarterly results. The Nvidia Analyst: Join Pitzer reiterated an Outperform rating on Nvidia and increased the price target from $225 to $400, signaling roughly 33% upside from current levels.

title: Nvidia: Metaverse Turns its Hype Factor to 11
text: Nvidia is building an entire software stack for the metaverse, from chips to computers to application interfaces, hoping to take full advantage of the new buzzword. The post Nvidia: Metaverse Turns its Hype Factor to 11 appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Relentless Innovation Makes Nvidia Stock the Gift That Keeps On Giving
text: Nvidia has been a leader in the graphics-card niche for years, but the company's recent initiatives will only add value to NVDA stock. The post Relentless Innovation Makes Nvidia Stock the Gift That Keeps On Giving appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Nvidia ETFs in Focus Ahead of Q3 Earnings
text: Given the higher chances of an earnings beat, ETFs having the largest allocation to NVIDIA could make compelling plays ahead of its earnings report.

title: Earnings Previews: Cisco Systems, Nvidia
text: This week's earnings include a truckload of retailers. Two Dow Jones industrial stocks (Home Depot and Walmart) both beat expectations Tuesday morning.

title: Nvidia-Arm Deal Faces UK National Security Probe: CNBC
text: The U.K. Digital and Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries ordered a "phase 2" investigation into NVIDIA Corp's (NASDAQ: NVDA) $40 billion bid for Cambridge chip designer Arm, CNBC reports. Competition and Markets Authority will initiate the probe over the next 24 weeks, including antitrust concerns and national security issues associated with the deal.

title: ARM Holdings takeover to face full inquiry as UK government cites national security concerns
text: US chipmaker Nvidia Inc's attempts to buy Arm Holdings have seemingly run into a major roadblock after the UK government launched a ‘phase 2' competition inquiry on national security grounds Digital secretary Nadine Dorries said:  “ARM has a unique place in the global technology supply chain and we must make sure the implications of this transaction are fully considered. “The CMA will now report to me on competition and national security grounds and provide advice on the next steps.

title: Nvidia's pending Arm merger faces heightened regulatory scrutiny as competitive concerns mount
text: Nvidia Corp.'s deal for Arm Ltd. faces additional regulatory scrutiny after its was referred for additional investigation in the U.K.

title: UK orders national security review of NVIDIA deal to buy Arm
text: American technology company NVIDIA's planned $40 billion takeover of British chip designer Arm Ltd. faces months of delays after the U.K. government asked competition regulators Tuesday to investigate the national security implications of the deal.

title: Nvidia Earnings: What to Look For
text: Nvidia (NVDA) reports Q3 earnings after market close on Nov. 17. Can it reaccelerate revenue growth in its data center segment?

title: Nvidia's New Multibillion-Dollar Opportunity Could Be a Huge Catalyst

title: UK opens in-depth probe of Nvidia-ARM deal, citing national security and competition concerns
text: Chipmaker Nvidia's planned $40 billion purchase of UK-based chip designer ARM will face an in-depth probe by the UK's competition regulator after the government ordered the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) to take a closer look at the proposed transaction. The UK's digital secretary, Nadie Dorries, said today that she has written to the CMA […]

title: UK orders in-depth probe of Nvidia's Arm acquisition
text: LONDON (Reuters) -Britain on Tuesday ordered an in-depth investigation of Nvidia Corp's planned $50 billion-plus acquisition of UK-based chip designer Arm from Japan's SoftBank over antitrust and national security concerns.

title: Nvidia's $40 billion takeover of chip designer Arm faces a UK national security probe
text: The U.K. government has announced that it wants a full-blown investigation into Nvidia's takeover of Cambridge chip designer Arm.

title: Nvidia Stock Before Earnings: Buy, Hold, or Sell?
